result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Meadows

records.addlTxt: CASH BOND POSTED IN 14CF110 - CK # 14C 022033 $250.00 TO DOC FOR RESTITUTION IN 13CF288
FACE SHEET & TRANSMISSION VERIFICATION REPORT, SENT TO SPARTA PROBATION
DEF PRESENT W/ATTY HAMM - COURT ADVISES OF RIGHT TO PRELIMINARY HEARING - DEF WAIVES PRELIMINARY HEARING - COURT FINDS PROBABLE CAUSE AND BINDS DEF OVER FOR TRIAL
Letter received from Attorney Hamm to Judge Rice dated May 19, 2014.
Review hearing on May 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Order for Pretrial Conference and Status (Felony--Time Limits Waived)

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Hamm.  Court lowers bond to $250 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previous bond.  Defendant waives reading.  Court gives right to Preliminary Hearing within 20 days.  Defendant waives time limits to Preliminary Hearing.
Pretrial Offer- May 5, 2014
Pretrial Conference- May 5, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.
Status Conference- May 19, 2014 @ 3:00 p.m.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.  
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON POSTING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am except for work purposes or treatment purposes as approved by Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant can only be released Monday-Friday, 8am-3:30pm, so defendant can sign up for Bond Monitoring Program.
